Amazon Lex concepts a bot
contains all of the components of a
conversation which you want to have with
your customer and intent represents a
goal that the bots user or your customer
wants to achieve think buying a plane
ticket or scheduling an appointment and
utterance is a spoken or tied phrase
that invokes an intent I want to book a
hotel or want to order flowers are two
simple utterances each slot is a piece
of data that the user must supply in
order to fulfill the intent think of
slots as variables and a travel bot
could have slots for cities states or
airports for example a prompt is a
question that asks the user to supply
some data for a slot that is needed to
carry out the users intent and lastly
fulfillment is the actual business logic
that carries out the user's intent Lex
supports the use of lambda functions for
fulfillment once you have selected the

one area in which developers often face
challenges in is with managing
application data to elaborate data
requirements can vary across different
vices and these become exponentially
harder when multiple users share data
across them this is where concerns like
syncing data and conflict resolution for

users want instant access to their

have tried to address all of these

appsync AWS app sync is a surveillance
back-end service based on craft QL for
building web and mobile applications it
is ideal for real time use cases offline
data scenarios and greatly simplifies
data access patterns for developers
graph QL is an alternative way of
thinking about api's when compared to
rest and gives clients the power to ask
for exactly what they need and nothing
more from the server it makes it easier
to evolve your API is overtime and
enables powerful developer toolkits one
of the advantages of graph QL is that
instead of calling multiple restful api
from your clients then manipulating the
data and stitching them together for
presentation you can build a single API
endpoint which can serve various types
of requests thus simplifying your client
server interactions overall appsync
integrates with the Apollo graph QL

front-end frame
works including react react native
JavaScript and the native Android and

over WebSockets by using graphical

this is especially useful since
